question: CSOM with Picket fence fever is seen in
exp: Sigmoid sinus thrombosis/lateral sinus thrombosis is an inflammation of inner wall of lateral venous sinus with formation of an intra sinus thrombus It occurs as a complication of chronic suppuration of middle ear or acute coalescent mastoiditis, and cholesteatoma Picket fence fever temperature never comes back to normal baseline. Remittent fever. Complications of CSOM - Intra temporal Intracranial Mastoiditis Meningitis - m/c Petrositis Brain abscess Facial paralysis Extradural abscess Labyrinthitis Subdural abscess Lateral sinus thrombophlebitis Otitic hydrocephalus

question: All of the following are the uses of given instrument except :
exp: Mollison's mastoid retractor Self retaining mastoid retractor with four prongs on either blade USES- Harvesting Temporalis fascia Used in mastoidectomy to retract soft tissues after incision and elevation of flaps It is self retaining and haemostatic Mastoid Gouge -Help in removal of bone Perkin's mastoid retractor has 1x3 prongs
opc: In mastoidectomy to retract soft tissues after incision

question: A mastoid CT SCan Axial cross section given below depicts which type of pathological mastoid among given options ?
exp: Acellular mastoid along with surrounding tissue destroyed occurs in Sclerotic mastoid Mastoid Cancellous bone: consist of air cells( "honeycomb" ) Largest air cell is mastoid antrum 3 types of mastoid are :- Pneumatized:Mastoid cells are well developed and intervening septa are thin Diploetic: Mastoid consists of marrow spaces and a few air cells Sclerotic or acellular:No air cells mastoid air cells before and after sclerosis
